title: Mystery MTV Style Font
content:
Hi guys,

We desperately need help finding this "MTV Generation" font.

Hope it's not too ugly a font to post here!

Thanks for the help,  
J

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [whatfont.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223160004/http:/typophile.com/files/whatfont_3.jpg) | 37.87 KB |
author: MadAboutType

comments.content: MTV has a penchant for the bespoke. I'd guess it is custom.
I looked it up: 'bespoke'= Heavily customised or written from scratch to meet the customers requirements.
:^P Eben, you had to look that up? Or, are you making fun of my use of it?
I TOTALLY had to look it up and I am not making even an iota of fun. But I figured if I wasn't sure maybe other people... etc.

I'm such a sucker for that schoolbook naive shadow look and often have to find good reasons not to use it, still haven't got over lo-fi

--N

That looks totally custom/drawn in and scanned.

But I'm sure the interweb has plenty of similarly styled extruded handritten blocky text...

A quick search on myfonts yielded this:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/brubecks-cube/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223160004/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/brubecks-cube/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/brubecks-cube/")
Is [F Santo Domingo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223160004/http:/www.fontshop.com/products/fuse13.cfm) (FUSE 13 - Superstition) good enough for ya?

Thanks, that's brilliant.

We might end up using it for various typesetting jobs so I'd like to get a version with the black fill - but not sure if it's possible. Maybe able to achieve this with Font editing software? Not my area of expertise.

Cheers,  
J

Blockhead, from Emigre is similar without the cross-hatching

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/blockhead/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223160004/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/blockhead/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/blockhead/")
This is the place to ask for that expertise if you decide you want it.

There's also a similar one called Action Jackson, I believe from Divide By Zero.

- Lex

\> _I TOTALLY had to look it up and I am not making even an iota of fun. But I figured if I wasn’t sure maybe other people… etc._

Tiff, ditto here. Don't forget there are quite a few non-native speakers visiting Typophile. ;^)

Thanks for looking that up, Eben. :^)
You might also like [Hilde Caps](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223160004/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/joebob/hilde-caps) by Jeroen Van Der Ham.

But 'bespoke' is being used by a lot of people now. Although I was being a tad sarcastic by using it, I was still serious. (For a change.)

O:^)
I'm a native English speaker, and I didn't know it. But I'm going to use it now!
You must run in a fun crowd Tiff! Cheers.

Maybe one could go so far as to say 'MTV has a penchant for the tawdry'

Dafont.com must singlehandedly supply their in-house team!
